review_title: They treat their hard working employees like they are disposable garbage

pros: Good benefits but long hours

pros: I've been employed at the hospital for almost 6 years.  I recently left the hospital (and went from a full-time to a per diem position) to try a different type of nursing elsewhere since the hospital has been all I've known as an RN.  I came to realize fairly quickly that the grass is not greener on the other side!  I just applied for my transfer back into the hospital for another full-time position and was hired back. The hospital has a lot to offer and I have a new appreciation for it!  They provide plenty of education and there's always opportunities to advance your career.  Tuition reimbursement is definitely a perk. The PTO time offered is generous. But what I missed the most was the wonderful staff and support system that I didn't have at the other company.  I recommend the hospital for employment and won't be leaving again!
cons: I believe the cons are the same as you would have at any job.  Some days are good and some not so much.  But there's always a support system surrounding you to help with any needs you may have.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Reading, PA
pros: Competitive salary which is reviewed annually
cons: Career ladder which can dictate your base salary rate

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Reading, PA
pros:
Great working environment
Learning experience 
They help with school
cons: Points system is ridiculous. The base pay is also ludicrous

review_title: Not as good as it used to be
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Reading, PA

pros:
Great place to work.

cons: Company Culture and hierarchy aren’t great

job_title: RN Full Time Pool in Pottstown, PA
pros: Opportunity to learn if someone is actually willing to help
cons: Most of the nurses are not willing to help, very clicky.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Reading, PA
pros: My co workers and Nursing Supervisor are great, definitely I can say they hire great people!! Real team oriented people. Benefits are pretty good and there are perks.
cons: As most places in the healthcare industry extremely short staffed 80% of the time. Patients safety and care is always on the back burner when it comes to staffing and patient needs. We do the best we can with the team we have but when we ask for help it's ignored by the people pulling the strings. Definitely sad!! But we have to get told about how low are patient satisfaction is or how many inpatient falls/ injuries we have gotten. Just wish they were proactive. My supervisor definitely has stuck her neck out though time and time again. Oh and their point system for absences is unfair and unreal. People are encouraged to use the employee health clinic instead of ED for acute issues. But if their own employee health clinic tells you, you are too sick to return to work you get points despite have the time you contract the illness from the job.

pros: The group of people you were with are great.
cons: Short staff has created stress

pros: Great benefits, nice coworkers and typically well staffed
cons: Attendance policy is a bit strict.

pros:
The people I have worked with over the years have been great. Benefits overall very good.
Medical on line resources good.
cons:
Well, my salary started out good but never a raise. That has been discouraging as I work long hours and have been committed to making improvements. 
An "old boys network "; very unfair. I got tired of not being recognized for my accomplishments, so I have chosen to move on. 
We used to enjoy our work, now I look around at burned out employees who many want to leave or cannot wait to retire. We spoke up, asked for more help only to get told no because they built a 320 million dollar surgical tower. Forget about what we do everyday for the hospital . I am not waiting anymore, I am leaving. So sad, the organization has changed for the worst over the past five years.

review_title: Always expanding striving to improve healthcare for their community.
pros: Employees here provide wondeful patient care. We work as a team through all things. There are multiple areas to work if you decide you would like to move on to something new or different. They do have the CAP program that allows you to expand professionally. They are partnered with many programs to make furthering education easier with working. TRHMC comes together to raise awareness and monetary gifts to help the community. We strive to give the best hospital experience a patient can have to make a time of stress easier on both the patient and the family.
cons: Alot of floors are short staffed at this time so you are asked to do extra shifts to cover. Benefits are limited to the Reading Hospital and Medical Center groups only. You can go elsewhere but will be paying out of pocket. There is a lack of communication between levels of management to staff employees. Depending upon the area that you work you may feel a lack of respect towards your hard work. You are expected to join multiple commitees and go to mutliple meetings during your work days and days off.

pros: I like the people, that is all.
cons: Management is not the best.

review_title: New hire in revenue and contracting
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Reading, PA
pros: Benefits are comprable two other companies PTO is good at first but there should be accruel time allowed within three years of being an employee instead of 10 plus years
cons: They do not tell you when they hire you that you have to park behind the VFW Outlets so they are not honest about that they do not put into consideration if you have children to pick up or places to be they should tell you that at the time that they offer you the position and  you have to take a shuttle back and forth the only way you get to park in the garage or parking spots is if you are a nurse working non business hours. This adds about an extra 20 minutes both ways to your time. They also should treat employees in other areas such as revenue cycle and Managed Care differently than they do as Healthcare Providers or nurses as it is not the same it is a business not a hospital and it is not an hourly or per diem position. Very old school

pros: None at this time of covid
cons: Got rid of 1000 workers off because Reading Hospital made poor decisions.

review_title: I love my job it self bc it's very rewarding but it is  treated as a business not a healthcare facility.
pros: You get good benefits. Raise every year.  If you work at a dr office full time,  holidays are a paid day off.
cons: Be prepared for things to change all the time.. Even rules. Watch what you tell other employees. Don't gossip, and leave personal life outside of work. You are replaceable at anytime.

review_title: Drama central - not worth the money
pros: Salary and benefits are decent,  they need to be to attract talent
cons: Operating in the past.   Upper management is so busy looking at the future, they are ignoring the present. Middle management is so focused on the past and what they have accomplished,  they are not preparing for the future. Everything is reactionary.  If you like high school, you will love it here.  Advancement is based on your friendships and your managers opinion,  not on your abilities or accomplishments.  Stand up to make a change against the wrong person and you ware gone.  Too many bullies pushing their view on others when the bullies truly do not know what they are doing.  Hollywood could learn something about drama from this place.  Very few people here understand the difference between a small community hospital and being a regional health system, and management does not want to know the difference.

review_title: Stay away, it's getting Bad, and good people are bailing out while they can, before they get canned!
job_title: Nurse Anesthetist in West Reading, PA
pros: Decent location out of the city, good staff, but poor management. Salary is par with the local area, benefits are OK, and could be nicer if they want to, howerver....
cons:
Cutting hours, cut overtime, looking bad. 
Not a people friendly place to work, unless you like micromanagement, lack of autonomy and a restrictive practice.  The MDA's are VERY restrictive and management doesn't help at all. If the job you are looking for is a puppet position where it's the Reading Way or the Highway, then this is the place for you!  Take my advice and pass on this place.

review_title: RHS:  on the wrong path for quite some time now.. and getting worse
pros: The pay was good.
cons: Upper management who give lip service. Lots of Lies in this organization. High Drama everywhere! They are still escorting the best of the best to the door and saying GOODBYE... Not sure when they will wake up and realize that YOU need experienced people to stay ... NOT LEAVE... something else that has been bothering me... The HR department is just plain awful there... no caring ..no compassionate or kind people in this department.. just call the HR department on the phone.. and listen to how they speak to you or how they talk to you... and quite honestly.. its everyone in HR. They speak to the employees as if they are worthless... its a shame. Its a hospital... listen to your nurses people!!  Without nurses it wouldn't be a hospital!

job_title: Registered Nurse in West Reading, PA
pros: I have worked for reading for the past three to four years. I have truly enjoyed being part of this organization. The administration and management really do help you to successes as a member of their community. They give you the resources you need. For example, they have great educational benefits, such as tuition reimbursements. I am currently going for my FNP, almost finished, I only had to pay a small amount out of pocket because of the educational reimbursement program, which is phenomenal, especially for a masters degree. In addition, everyone encourages you to participate within the organization on teams and groups to help advance the organization. Your thoughts and ideas are heard and listened too.
cons: There are no major cons to working for this organization.  Continue to utilize open communications, forums, and town halls to help keep staff  informed of new changes and information.

pros: The two things I enjoy about working at Reading are my co workers and ,most of the time, my patients.
cons:
Administration does not care about employees.  Currently being implemented is a staffing grid that forces RNs to work 12 hour shifts. When some of my coworkers went to administration with concerns re: health and child care and the inability to work 12 hour shifts the responses they received were:
   -that is not our concern(This in response to someone who relies on day care.  Pa law says it is illegal to leave a child in day care for more than 10 hours a day.)
   -this facility functioned before you and will function after you
   -if you can't work 12 hrs then maybe you don't belong here.

pros: Acceptable pay and benefits with good coworkers and usually isn't stingy about over time hours.
cons:
Treats non-managers like they're worthless. Automatic 5's for managers in the yearly reviews but everyone else, whether they deal with patients directly or not get 1's? how does that make any sense? Drop a department to save money, then give another department all that work load and then some without even an attempt to act like they're going to increase pay? Doesn't seem to make sense to me. 

Doesn't seem like getting a job is really possible unless you know someone or are married to someone that works here already. That includes even moving up to a different position once you are an employee.

review_title: Worst working environment I have ever experienced/unbelievably bad nightmare!!!
pros: The patients are terrific to work with
cons: Cruel, angry nurse managers; managers split staff against each other; co-workers lie, connive and sabotage each other, and this is encouraged by management; managers and co-workers incessantly bully each other and patients; overworked and understaffed with no incentives; HR reps have no objectivity; all types of harassment are condoned and ignored by HR; HR secretly tapes conversations with employees; employees are retaliated against in the worst ways for reporting problems; best employees are treated the worst by insecure, undereducated, dishonest managers and co-workers. The administration is ruthlessly greedy and anti-labor. The hospital is dirty and bug-infested. Some employees have toilet mouths and steal money from patients belongings. Hospital attempts to scare employees into remaining a union-free shop.

pros: The health system provides excellent care and their benefits provided to employees is out of this world.   Very generous tuition reimbursement, pto and holidays
cons: The organization needs to start from scratch and revise the various teams and committees as well as the hierarchy.  The on boarding process is painful and leaves one struggling with the pieces needed to manage effectively.   The system has been going through many changes over the last two years and they are definitely headed in the right direction but still long way to go

review_title: worst cna job I ever had
job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Reading, PA
pros: some of my co-workers were great knew what they were doing and worked as a team.  health benefits were ok.
cons: where do i begin!  Very strict policy's even when your a patient in the hospital its held against you there is no excused absences!!!   Poor staffing.  Co-workers who don't know what they are doing, sleeping on the job then they are the ones who get what ever time off they want.  Because they are short staffed they give u a hard time about taking off.  i had a hard time getting my wedding/ honeymoon off when it was requested  a year in advance!!!  joke for a raise.  they also cut retirement benefits!   bent over the LPN's. they don't care how hard you work or how long you have been there its all about the board and top management getting their bonuses!!!

job_title: Central Monitoring Room in Reading, PA
pros: RHS is an employer that will pay you reliably and provide reasonable benefits however, don't expect to be paid well. The hospital is notorious cheap and often replacing well established and experienced RN's and support for "less expensive" and inexperienced staff. There is a high level of turnover within nursing and support staff.
cons: Unless your a doctor or within the administrator RHS will continue to make budget cuts effecting employee moral and productivity. The employees are underpaid and often expected to complete tasks well beyond their job descriptions. Management makes decisions based on budget alone and seldom takes into account the individual.

job_title: Laboratory Supervisor in West Reading, PA
pros: I have been working for Reading Health System (RHS) since 2005. The work that I do at RHS is very exciting and challenging at the same time. I have been able to grow and develop my skills together with the organization over the past 11 years. I get to work with great people who are supportive. This includes peers and administration. I have great benefits and a fair pay. I have pride in the organization and the mission and goals that they strive to obtain. RHS goes above and beyond to recognize their employees by providing tokens of appreciation (luncheons, gifts, etc...) several times a year.
cons: I don't really have any cons as I have enjoyed being a part of the team.

job_title: Assistant Nurse Manager in West Reading, PA
pros: Tons of resources you just wont find at other hospitals in the area, big or small.  CNO quite supportive of nursing staff growth and development.  nursing and support staff are friendly and helpful overall.
cons: pay and benefits not as competitive as they should be.  Current position doe not seem to be as advertised, interviewed for or hired.  Feels like a "bait and switch".  If I leave in the near future, it will be for this reason.

pros: Bedside nurses really care about patients and each other. They are very willing to help each other out with information, as well as a helping hand when unit is overwhelming or under staffed.
cons: Administration continues to downplay the individual nurse's true value and importance to the hospital. Many are threatened with the "we can always replace you."  This is very detrimental to the retention of very qualified and experienced nurses. Administration  also is physically changing charts to hide mistakes that are done, in order to hide the mistake from the patient. This goes against every grain of medical training.

review_title: I grew very thick skin working the facilities management department for 14 years.
job_title: Facilities Management Manager in West Reading, PA
pros: Good restaurants, good employee discount for meals, great PTO and IPA program.
cons: Upper management constantly making changes to culture. Threat of unionizing till hospital gave everyone considerable raises. Upper management does not treat employees well. Human resources is a joke, left Director of HR go. Seems to have turned into a revolving door establishment. If not part of the in crowd your days are numbered.  Employees constantly overloaded due to under staffing.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in West Reading, PA
pros: Coworkers are great, availability of resources is great.
cons: Middle management constantly making decisions that make no sense to a floor nurse.  Everything is a late reaction to problems in the house as opposed to management thinking ahead which is frustrating to a profession built on planning ahead.  Unsafe staffing with constant promises to improve but management never follows through.  A ton of unnecessary BS to make any real changes.

review_title: All they care about is making money and they treat their employees and patients like trash.
pros: NONE! Do not work here.
cons: Low pay, they work you like a dog. You have to clock out to use the bathroom. The PTO benefit is a scam. Every time you want to take off you are denied because they are always short staffed. High turnover rates, everyone hates working there. Don't talk about creating a union unless you want to get fired.  Also evey time you don't meet their monthly goals which are never reasonable you get a strike. 3 strikes and you are out. Do not work for them.

pros:
Nice working environment (facility)
Good workers providing great care
cons:
Notice how most in nursing or technology fields are unhappy?!
New business practices for healthcare are a failure. Always more expectations on productivity numbers and decreased time frames.
Preaches patient first environment but doesn't follow that practice.
Does not maintain employee satisfaction-you're a number and can be replaced at any time
no matter how good or dedicated you are.
Heavy on management.

review_title: The Reading Hospital and Medical Center
pros: Good case variety, very up-to-date equipment, very organized. Hospital until very recently was considered very healthy from a financial point.
cons: Excessively presriptive anesthesiologists who as a group do not respect the nurse anesthetists. The CRNAs are treated as though they live within a "caste system" below the MDs.

review_title: Beware of Reading. Consider Lancaster General, Lehigh, or St Joes over Reading.
pros: Nurses genuinely care for the well being of the patient. The nurses might not always be competent, well trained, or experienced... but the intent of good will is definitely present. I suppose this could also be a con. I'd personally like mean nurses who knew what they were doing.
cons: Limited to no room for advancement. The culture is close minded and elitist, they are accepting of few people unless they are local. Don't be fooled by the big city facade, this is a podunk, backwoods, crap hole.

pros: We are treated well and respected.  The organization has had a major positive overhaul in the past 10 years.  Now you need to invest in your workforce.  To continue to attract great talent!
cons: Some departments are short staffed and over-worked!  The hiring process takes too long.  Get out of your comfort zone and think creatively when hiring.

review_title: Terrible treatment of employees and patient care is suffering!
pros: Excellent educators and Excellent nurses!
cons: I have been an RN for 11 years and have been at Reading for 5 years, my husband has been there for  18 years, and the hospital is at it's worst! Patient safety is an ongoing issue and is low on managements agenda. We as nurses, have terrible healthcare coverage, even using our OWN HOSPITAL!! WE need a Union and we will get one!

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Reading, PA
pros: The other nurses on my unit are great.
cons: There is not enough staff which makes most work days very stressful. It is difficult to keep up with the workload and leave work on time.

review_title: I loved it, I was very sad to go.
pros: The people are great and they are very helpful. The was pretty good as well as the benefits.
cons: The down sizing of course and there were a couple of people I worked with that just did the minimum of work to get buy. I know that sounds petty but that bothers me.

review_title: Changing, will it be better?  Not with same middle management
pros: Salary is competitive with great benefits.
cons: Middle management bullies, harrass but get away with it.  Quick to judge.   Lot of workers who slack but never get called to task about it (yes management knows who they are).

pros: Lots of educational opportunities  Good support for new nurses.  One of the few area hospitals that will hire graduate nurses.
cons: Pay is low for the area.  Staff often feels as if they have no "voice".

job_title: Electronics Tech in West Reading, PA
pros: It's warm. People (except new mgt) are friendly.
cons:
Management disconnect. (The new folks. just do not care about the old family.)
You can only use their healthcare for most problems.
Decisions all come down to the cheapest option. (Not the way it used to be.) Decisions were based on best practice.

pros: Many good people work at the hospotal or for the Medical Group
cons:
SOOOOOOOOO many politics between divisions, departments, personalities. It is a minefield.
High drama and backstabbing. Control freak managers, who are secretive and don't really manage.
Lot's of contradiction and secrecy.

review_title: The hospital no longer appreciates experienced, hard-working employees.
pros:
Benefits are good for the region
Location is convenient and pleasant
Many of the staff members are great to work with
cons:
Blatant favoritism goes unchecked
Untrustworthy - covertly laying off staff within multiple departments
Mid and senior management do not respect individuals
Upper management communicates one thing but does another - mission and value statements not followed

review_title: good technology but does not value employees
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Reading, PA
pros: decent benefits, technology is up-to-date
cons: company does not value employees- you are just a number on their financial budget no matter how hard you work to the top. when finances get tight, experienced RN's are the first to go to save money

pros: Uplifting educational work environment, cohesive staff. Management tends to be positive.
cons: Redundancy in charting at times, needs clarification on yearly job reviews, can be confusing.

pros: Committed to supporting the career growth of employees through a generous Educational assistance program, onsite continuing education  & an internal recruitment program.  Lots of employee recognition events and tokens of appreciation.  Many smiles and warm hellos are exchanged when walking the halls.
cons: Many changes but all are appropriate and needed.

pros: steady work, never laid off
cons: supervisors do not stick up for employees, unreasonable work load, rampant favoritism, always looking for a reason to write up hourly employees.One supervisor will say one thing another will tell you something else and yet they will back each other and make you look and sound like a liar.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technologist in Reading, PA
pros: Great management - even though there were a few layoffs in earlier years. Everything was always kept up (infrastructure-wise). Always clean, housekeeping did a great job. A good hospital.
cons: Parking. You start out parking at an off-site location and get shuttled in. Dont know if this has changed recently but they should add a parking garage.

pros: benefits are good easy for me to get to work vacations are fair for everyone and PTO also days off is fair I also like every other weekend off
cons: sometimes communication is not good between shifts and between departments and at times have to pick up what the prior shift left behind

pros: Good experience, patient care and team work.
cons: I have no regrets working at my current job, I need to get more experience in different fields since I have an associate degree now.

pros: There Is no longer anything good about the hospital. Look at most of the reviews. They are anonymous jobs.Several Months ago they had a 2 average. Now it's 3.5. I'm calling bull. Conditions have only gotten worse.
cons: Hospital will now openly state that you are replaceable. Staff cut to the point that respiratory now has to act as nursing aids. Open animosity to the staff. The place is a preassure cooker. Waiting to go off.

pros: Magnet hospital, good benefits, teaching hospital, recent expansion, new technology, good hospital for entry level nurses, good patient experience scores.
cons: Low pay, expensive benefits, high turnover rate, inexperienced staff, inexperienced doctors, high patient to nurse ratios, consistently under staffed, would not recommend staying there.

review_title: Great opportunity to advance your nursing career
job_title: Senior Recruiter in West Reading, PA
pros:
Leader in tuition reimbursement to advance your educational goals.
Accessible hands on Nursing Leadership team.
On the Magnet Journey
cons: A challenging and constantly changing environment.

review_title: Room for promotion and decent benefits
pros: Education assistance and health benefits. Level and quality of care supersedes competing facilities. Patient safety and experience is priority.
cons: Sometimes poor staff to patient ratio, but that happens most places

pros: Senior management cares about the patients and the staff
cons: The surrounding city of Reading is not so great

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in West Reading, PA
pros: The best reasons to work for Reading Hospital are the fringe benefits and the opportunity for advancement.
cons: The biggest downside to the Reading Hospital is the shortage of parking.

review_title: Great job, but not the greatest flexibility in scheduling
pros:
Educated, professional colleagues
Team-work oriented
Opportunities for advancement
cons:
Pay was significantly lower than same job at another facility
Not enough staff to cover all assignments at times
Difficult to schedule time off, even in advance

pros: The benefits and salary are very competitive.  Working conditions are state of the art.
cons: Alot of change, but is the norm for healthcare right now.

pros: fun place, hospitals have a feel good environment
cons: micromanaged, new leadership thinks you grow by cutting.

review_title: Management is disconnected and just does not care about it's employees anymore.
pros: I work with some pretty awesome people! Great physicians!
cons: very poor benefits and wages, unreasonable patient-staff ratios and worsening, management is disconnected from staff and clueless about what is going on in their own hospital, management changes policies at a whim to suit their needs......
